name: Dédé Saint Prix
description:
'''Dédé Saint Prix''' (born 10 February 1953) is a French singer from [[Martinique]], performing traditional [[chouval bwa]] music. He has used elements of modern styles in his recordings, including [[tambour]], [[hip hop music]], [[Charanga (Cuba)|charanga]], [[ragga]], [[son (music)|son]], [[Zouk (musical movement)|zouk]], [[Compas|kompa]] and [[rara music|rara]]. He has been performing for more than 38 years and has released at least 25 albums. He is also a composer and [[flautist]]. He taught music until 1991; since that time he has devoted his time to study and performance of Caribbean rhythmic traditions, with worldwide appearances.

In 2012, he was made a Chevalier de la [[Légion d’honneur]].
